title: 3DTILES_implicit_tiling extension
description: This extension enables 3D Tiles to support tilesets with implied subdivision schemes

subdivisionScheme.description: A string describing the subdivision scheme used within the tileset.

subtreeLevels.description: The number of distinct levels in each subtree. For example, a quadtree with `subtreeLevels = 2` will have subtrees with 5 nodes (one root and 4 children)

maximumLevel.description: The level of the deepest available tile. Levels are numbered from 0 starting at the tile with the `3DTILES_implicit_tiling` extension. This tile's children are at level 1, the children's children are at level 2, and so on.

subtrees.description: A template URI pointing to subtree files. A subtree is a fixed-depth (defined by `subtreeLevels`) portion of the tree to keep memory use bounded. The URI of each file is substituted with the subtree root's global level, x, and y. For tiling scheme `OCTREE`, z must also be given.

content.description: An object describing the type and location of tile content.
